title: Carl Ehrhard 2014 Rüdesheim Kabinett Feinherb Riesling (Rheingau)
description: Just a shade off dry, this delicately sweet Riesling showers the palate in a cascade of fresh grapefruit, apple and lemon flavors. It's straightforward in style but refreshing and enjoyable, finishing with hints of bramble and earth. Drink now through 2019.

title: Caruso & Minini 2015 Naturalmente Bio Catarratto (Sicilia)
description: Heady aromas of white wild flower, chopped herb and a whiff of honeydew melon lead the nose. The enjoyable palate offers ripe lemon and juicy nectarine that carry through to the tangy finish.

title: Cave de Lugny 2013 La Carte  (Mâcon-Lugny)
description: This wine comes from a single vineyard in the heart of the appellation. It is soft, just hinting at the lime acidity while focused on ripe yellow and green-plum fruits. This wine can develop further and will be at its best from 2017.

title: Cave de Turckheim 2015 Pinot Blanc (Alsace)
description: Ripe, juicy pear appears as a pristine, expressive flavor on nose and palate. Body and structure are light and just off dry. Drink soon while at its delicious peak.

title: Chanson Père et Fils 2013  Nuits-St.-Georges
description: In this generous interpretation of Nuits Saint-Georges, ripe berry fruits burst through the typical dry tannins. It has plenty of red-fruit flavors, a generous texture and structure. Drink this already attractive wine from 2018.

title: Château des Tourtes 2015 Cuvée Classique Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)
description: This wine is crisp and refreshingly fruity. With red currant and bright spicy acidity, it is lively, just hinting at a tannic edge. It finishes with a burst of raspberries.

title: Boedecker Cellars 2013 Stewart Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: The Stewart cuvée is lightly smoky, with plenty of up-front flavor. It marries cherry fruit to citrusy acidity, with a chunky, robust core and a crisp, clean finish.

title: Bonterra 2013 Merlot (Mendocino)
description: Delicious ripe berry and cherry flavors make this medium-bodied wine very lush and fruity. It does have moderate tannins for texture, but the richness of fruit just drenches the palate.

title: Château Vartely 2014 D'Or Traminer (Moldova)
description: This 100% Traminer is light bodied and has aromas of pineapple, peach, kumquat and rose petal. It is soft and balanced in the mouth with flavors of peach, apricot and lychee.

title: Cramele Recas 2014 Legendary Estate Series Chardonnay (Romania)
description: This Romanian Chardonnay has a perfumed nose of vanilla, white flowers and ripe banana. It is medium bodied with flavors of papaya, guava, mango and honeydew melon.

title: CVA Canicattì 2015 Delicio Rosato (Terre Siciliane)
description: A 50-50 blend of Nero d'Avola and Nerello Mascalese, this boasts fruity and spicy aromas of wild berry, fennel and Mediterranean herb. The fresh, juicy palate offers crushed strawberry, wild cherry and a note of white pepper. A hint of tangerine and a saline note close the crisp finish.

title: Domaine Alzitana 2015 Rosé (Corse)
description: Situated on the east coast of Corsica, this vineyard is 50 hectares. The wine is ripe, full in the mouth and refreshingly fruity. There is a touch of spice as well as great waves of fresh acidity.

title: Trinchero 2012 Cloud's Nest Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Mount Veeder)
description: A full-bodied, robust expression of the variety from an appellation that can sometimes be relatively cool, this shows deft characteristics of savory pepper, cedar and a tightness of lively acidity. While fresh it's also heavy, with a finish of black tea.

title: Turkey Flat 2015 Rosé (Barossa Valley)
description: Turkey Flat's rosé has been an Aussie staple for more than decade. The 2015 is 92% Grenche, with the balance a blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Shiraz, Dolcetto and Mataro. Crushed stone and red berry scents lead the way, followed by flavors that are reminiscent of white chocolate and strawberries. It's fairly weighty for a rosé, with a long, slightly viscous finish.

title: Undurraga 2013 Gran Reserva Sibaris Carmenère (Colchagua Valley)
description: Hard, rubbery blackberry and black-currant flavors are herbal but settle with airing. This feels round, fresh and fair. Flavors of spiced plum, blackberry, carob and generic spices finish dark and foresty, with good overall balance.

title: Soléna 2014 Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)
description: After 12 months in 22% new French oak, this well-made wine offers pleasing scents of toast and butter. Similar flavors are married to clean apple and pear. Drink now through 2020.

title: Villa Matilde 2015 Rocca dei Leoni Falanghina (Campania)
description: Intense aromas of tropical fruit, banana and white stone fruit lead the nose on this straightforward, refreshing wine. The vibrant palate doles out juicy pineapple, citrus and white peach alongside tangy acidity.

title: Viña Casablanca 2012 Nimbus Single Vineyard Syrah (Casablanca Valley)
description: Rubbery berry, tea, cool mint, herb and savory aromas amount to something a bit funky. This Syrah feels chewy and tannic. Herbal, savory, soupy flavors finish with an infusion of tea-like influences on closing plum and berry fruit notes.

title: Weingut Karp-Schreiber 2014 Brauneberger  Kabinett Trocken Riesling (Mosel)
description: Zingy lemon-lime flavors pierce the palate of this zesty dry-style Riesling. It's remarkably sheer in mouth feel with a crystalline briskness to the finish. Drink now through 2019.

title: La Tourbeille 2015 L'esprit de Jeanne Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)
description: This structured wine from the Tourbeille vineyard at Domaine du Petit Roque offers some definite tannins as well as red-currant flavors. It is crisp and textured, hinting at minerality. The aftertaste is perfumed and fresh.

title: Principe di Corleone 2015 Pollara Grillo (Sicilia)
description: Delicate scents of lemon blossom, spring wild flower and citrus waft out of the glass. The vibrant, easygoing palate doles out nectarine, aromatic herb, white peach and a mineral note alongside bright acidity.

title: Quai de la Lune 2015 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)
description: Citrus and red-fruit aromas make for an attractive, perfumed wine. On the palate, a fresh character comes from the red currant and raspberry fruits. It is light and bright with a tight, mineral aftertaste.

title: Peter Franus 2013 Brandlin Vineyard Zinfandel (Mount Veeder)
description: Brambly berry and heaps of brown sugar combine for a thick, soft and richly layered wine that pushes the limits in terms of ripeness. It has small amounts of Mourvèdre, Charbono and Carignane blended throughout and was aged in one-third new French oak.

title: Planeta 2015 Alastro White (Sicilia)
description: Made with 70% Grecanico, 15% Grillo and 15% Sauvignon Blanc, this offers enticing scents of fragrant yellow flower, honeydew melon and citrus. The creamy, enveloping palate offers grapefruit, peach, tropical fruit and note of chopped Mediterranean herb.

title: Upper Five 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Rogue Valley)
description: There's a pleasing snap to this wine, which sends up scents and flavors of peavine and petrol. It's pungent and penetrating, with lime and citrus fruit (from organically-grown grapes) at the core. Drink lightly chilled, now through 2021.

title: Saddleback 2013 Estate Merlot (Oakville)
description: Big tannin overpowers this full-bodied, concentrated wine with lurking acidity, built around complex layers of drying oak, cedar, currant and cola. Soft on the palate, it presents a powerful interpretation of the variety, while retaining its essence.

title: Zacharias 2014 White Squared White (Corinth)
description: Tropical fruit, spice and honey on the nose give this Malagousia and Assyrtiko blend an opulent, exotic start. Balance is struck with its citrus and melon fruit backed by a clean acidity. Clean but full of character.

title: Wilderotter 2013 Syrah (Shenandoah Valley (CA))
description: This is a bold wine with aromas like Concord grapes, and flavors so ripe they are almost jammy, but it also has lively acidity and moderate tannins to keep the texture fresh. There is little oak flavor to get in the way of the pure expression of the grapes.

title: Apaltagua 2014 Envero Gran Reserva Estate Bottled Carmenère (Colchagua Valley)
description: Herbal black-plum flavors carry a strong side note of eucalyptus and spice. This feels crisp and fresh, but also tartaric. Flavors of herbal plum, black pepper and oak finish solid, with acidic push.

title: Ascension Cellars 2015 Siren Rosé (Paso Robles)
description: A darker shade of pink, this is rosé done in a rich style, but rather delicious throughout. Dark plum, baked cherry and ripe strawberry aromas meet with clove spice on the nose, and the palate offers tasty bubblegum and watermelon candy flavors. It's bold but balanced.
